ğŸ’Both Macaque Trail and Langur Trail is accessible from Old Upper Thomson Road.
ğŸ™‰Entering from Old Thomson Road, Macaque Trail leads into the forested area on a well kept jungle trail.
ğŸ™ˆA bridge spanned across a flowing downstream.
Intermittent chirping bird calls are heard from along the trail.
ğŸµMacaque Trail soon connect up with Langur Trail, which is a very short Trail that lead back to Old Upper Thomson Road.
ğŸ™ŠJust before the Langur Trail ends, is the ruins of a concrete wall and some pillars.
A short but interesting Trail.
As the name suggest, do expect macaque. May have a big group of them hanging around this area. Gentle slope and short trail out to other trails in the Park.

Lush greens, short trails, decent up and downslope but still bearable. Pathways mostly paved, may get kind of slippery. Few remnants of old building structure within the forest. Saw 2 snakes crawling, so please do look after yourself. One of the entrance was packed with macaques.
Beautiful place for a walk after eating prata. We saw 2 wild boars and 2 monkeys! A place where nature thrives
Walk round n round, enjoy the fresh air
